description: This table contains information on results from clinical system orders. This table extracts only the last Orders (ORD) contact for each ORD record.

columns.name: ORDER_PROC_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the procedure order record.

columns.name: LINE
columns.description: The line number of each result component within each ordered procedure.

columns.name: ORD_DATE_REAL
columns.description: This is a numeric representation of the date each order was placed in your system. The integer portion of the number specifies the date the order was placed. The digits after the decimal point indicate multiple orders on one day.

columns.name: ORD_END_DATE_REAL
columns.description: This is a numeric representation of the end date for each order in your system. The integer portion of the number specifies the date the order was placed. The digits after the decimal point indicate multiple orders on one day.

columns.name: RESULT_DATE
columns.description: The date the technician ran the tests for each order in calendar format.

columns.name: COMPONENT_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of each result component for each result.

columns.name: COMPONENT_ID_NAME
columns.description: The name of the component.

columns.name: PAT_ENC_CSN_ID
columns.description: A unique serial number for the associated patient encounter. This number is unique across all patients and encounters in the system.

columns.name: ORD_VALUE
columns.description: The value returned for each result component, in short free text format. NOTE:  This is how the data is stored in the database; as string format. Interface data may come in with alpha characters and this field is designed to store exactly what is stored in the database. This field stores numeric and structured numeric values in M internal format, using a period as the decimal separator irrespective of locale.

columns.name: ORD_NUM_VALUE
columns.description: A numeric representation of the value returned for each component where applicable. If the value contains any non-numeric characters, the value will display as 9999999.

columns.name: RESULT_FLAG_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category value associated with a standard HL7 flag code to mark each component result as abnormal. Any value in this field not equal to 1 is considered abnormal.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


(NONE)


Abnormal


Panic


Low


High


Low Panic


High Panic


Low Off-Scale


High Off-Scale


Sig Change Up


Sig Change Down


Better


Worse


Sensitive


Resistant


Intermediate


Moderately Sensitive


Very Sensitive

columns.name: REFERENCE_LOW
columns.description: The lowest acceptable value for each result component. If the value in this column is a number or structured numeric, the numbers will be stored in M internal format, using a period as the decimal separator.

columns.name: REFERENCE_HIGH
columns.description: The highest acceptable value for each result component. If the value in this column is a number or structured numeric, the numbers will be stored in M internal format, using a period as the decimal separator.

columns.name: REFERENCE_UNIT
columns.description: The units for each result component value.

columns.name: RESULT_STATUS_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category value corresponding to the status of each result record, such as 2-Preliminary, 3-Final, 4-Corrected, 5-Incomplete.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Preliminary


Final


Corrected


Incomplete

columns.name: RESULT_SUB_IDN
columns.description: This item is populated with the unique organism identifier (OVR 700 or interface) when the component of an order result is an organism and can be joined to ORDER_SENSITIVITY.SENS_ORGANISM_SID to identify details about this organism.

columns.name: LAB_STATUS_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category value associated with the status of each result, such as 1-In Progress, 2-Preliminary, 3-Final, 4-Edited.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


In process


Preliminary result


Final result


Edited


Edited Result - FINAL

columns.name: INTERFACE_YN
columns.description:
This Yes/No flag identifies whether each order was resulted through an interface. The field will display "Y" if the result came through an interface, otherwise the field will display "N".


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Yes


No

columns.name: RESULTING_LAB_ID
columns.description: The Unique ID of the Lab running the test.

columns.name: RESULTING_LAB_ID_LLB_NAME
columns.description: Interface laboratory name.

columns.name: COMPONENT_COMMENT
columns.description: Contains the comments associated with a order COMPONENT_ID, i.e. this is the comments associated with a specific order component's results. If comment data is too long to fit in this item, then the comments will be found in the ORDER_RES_COMMENT table.

columns.name: RESULT_IN_RANGE_YN
columns.description:
A Yes/No category value to indicate whether a result has been verified to be within its reference range.  This item is set by the interface when the result is sent. A null value is equivalent to a "no"  value. 


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


No


Yes

columns.name: REF_NORMAL_VALS
columns.description: This is a free-text item which allows you to enter a reference range without tying it to a "low" or "high" value. For example, it could be a string ("negative"), a list of choices ("Yellow, orange"), or a descriptive range ("Less than 20"). The values entered in this range should always represent the "normal" values. This item will be displayed in Results Review as the reference range, superseding any values in the low or high items. It may also be displayed in reports, if the print groups are configured to use it. Multiple responses are permitted (one per line). If the value in this column is a number or structured numeric, the numbers will be stored in M internal format using a period as the decimal separator.

columns.name: LRR_BASED_ORGAN_ID
columns.description: Used for storing discrete organisms. This item is used for storing isolated organisms at the component level. There may be cases where an isolated organism does not undergo sensitivity tests and therefore is only stored at the component level. Organisms with sensitivities are also stored in addition to this item.

columns.name: LRR_BASED_ORGAN_ID_NAME
columns.description: The name of the organism.

columns.name: COMP_RES_TECHNICIA
columns.description: ID of the Resulting Lab Technician.

columns.name: VALUE_NORMALIZED
columns.description: Will contain the structured numeric result value in a delimited structured numeric format. Numbers will be in M internal format. The delimited structured numeric value is the user entered structured numeric value converted to a delimited format. Valid structured numeric formats are range, operator followed by number, and number followed by operator the value stored in this item is of the format:    operator1_$c(16)_number1_$c(16)_operator2_$c(16)_number2.

columns.name: NUMERIC_PRECISION
columns.description: The number of decimal digits to the right of the decimal point.

columns.name: COMP_OBS_INST_TM
columns.description: Timestamp to track per non-micro result component when it was collected/observed.

columns.name: COMP_ANL_INST_TM
columns.description: Timestamp to track per non-micro result component when it was analyzed in lab.

columns.name: RESULT_VAL_START_LN
columns.description: For multi-line results holds the starting line number of RESULTS_CMT column from ORDER_RES_COMMENT table, where the result values begin.  This column is simply an indicator of the line number(s) where a result is stored.

columns.name: RESULT_VAL_END_LN
columns.description: For multi-line results holds the ending line number of RESULTS_CMT column from ORDER_RES_COMMENT table, where the result values begin.  This column is simply an indicator of the line number(s) where a result is stored.

columns.name: RESULT_CMT_START_LN
columns.description: For multi-line results holds the starting line number of RESULTS_CMT column from ORDER_RES_COMMENT table, where the result values begin.  This column is simply an indicator of the line number(s) where a result is stored.

columns.name: RESULT_CMT_END_LN
columns.description: For multi-line results holds the ending line number of RESULTS_CMT column from ORDER_RES_COMMENT table, where the result values begin.  This column is simply an indicator of the line number(s) where a result is stored.

columns.name: ORD_RAW_VALUE
columns.description: Stores the raw value of a numeric result as entered by the user. The value stored here and in column ORD_VALUE will be different in international locales for numeric data if the decimal separator used in that locale is a comma instead of a period. This is because ORD_VALUE will store numeric values in the M internal format.

columns.name: RAW_LOW
columns.description: Stores raw value of the minimum value of the result component mentioned in column REFERENCE_LOW. The value stored here and in REFERENCE_LOW will be different in international locales for numeric data if the decimal separator used in that locale is a comma instead of a period. This is because REFERENCE_LOW will store numeric data in M internal format.

columns.name: RAW_HIGH
columns.description: Stores raw value of the maximum value of the result component mentioned in column REFERENCE_HIGH. The value stored here and in REFERENCE_HIGH will be different in international locales for numeric data if the decimal separator used in that locale is a comma instead of a period. This is because REFERENCE_HIGH will store numeric data in M internal format.

columns.name: RAW_REF_VALS
columns.description: This column stores the raw value of REF_NORMAL_VALS (i.e. the reference normal values of the result component). Since REF_NORMAL_VALS will store numeric data in M internal format, the value stored here and in REF_NORMAL_VALS will be different in international locales if the decimal separator used in that locale is a comma instead of a period.

columns.name: ORGANISM_QUANTITY
columns.description: This item is used for storing isolated organisms at the component level. It contains the numeric or qualitative quantity of the organism that was observed.

columns.name: ORGANISM_QUANTITY_UNIT
columns.description: This item is used for storing isolated organisms at the component level. It contains the unit associated with the quantity of the organism that was observed.

columns.name: COMPON_LNC_ID
columns.description: Logical Observation Identifiers Names and Codes (LOINC) ID of the component.

columns.name: COMPON_LNC_SRC_C_NAME
columns.description:
Source of the component Logical Observation Identifiers Names and Codes (LOINC) ID.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Reported


Inferred

columns.name: COMP_SNOMED_SRC_C_NAME
columns.description:
Source of the Systemized Nomenclature of Medicine � Clinical Terms (SNOMED) code (reported vs inferred).


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: COMPON_LNC_SRC_C_NAME

columns.name: REF_UNIT_UOM_ID
columns.description: Pointer to the record that represents the component's units of measure.

columns.name: REF_UNIT_UOM_ID_UNIT_NAME
columns.description: Record name

columns.name: REF_RANGE_TYPE
columns.description: Displays the type of the reference range.

columns.name: ORGANISM_SNOMED_CT
columns.description: The Systemized Nomenclature of Medicine � Clinical Terms (SNOMED) code for the component's organism.

columns.name: ORGANISM_QUANTITY_SNOMED_CT
columns.description: The Systemized Nomenclature of Medicine � Clinical Terms (SNOMED) code for the component's organism quantity.

columns.name: PERFORMING_ORG_INFO_LINE
columns.description: This is used to indicate the performing organization information for the component. This item stores the line number of the ORD related group which is used to save the performing organization information.

columns.name: COMPON_EXCL_CDS_YN
columns.description:
To cache if the component has a value or comment that matches a value in Excluded result text (I LSD 768).


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: RESULT_IN_RANGE_YN

columns.name: RTF_VAL_START_LINE
columns.description: If the component result value is rich text, this column gives the first line of ORD_RTF_VAL_CMT that the value is stored in.

columns.name: RTF_VAL_END_LINE
columns.description: If the component result value is rich text, this column gives the last line of ORD_RTF_VAL_CMT that the value is stored in.

columns.name: RTF_CMT_START_LINE
columns.description: If the component comment is rich text, this column gives the first line of ORD_RTF_VAL_CMT that the component comment is stored in.

columns.name: RTF_CMT_END_LINE
columns.description: If the component comment is rich text, this column gives the last line of ORD_RTF_VAL_CMT that the component comment is stored in.

columns.name: RSLT_ACCR_FLAG_YN
columns.description:
This item determines the accreditation status of the corresponding component. If set to Y-Yes, the corresponding component is accredited. If set to N-No, the corresponding component is not accredited. If null, no evaluation was performed on the component to determine if it is accredited or not.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: RESULT_IN_RANGE_YN
